# Paul King (screenwriter)

|birth_place   = Los Angeles, California, U.S.
|death_date    =
|death_place   = Newport Beach, California, U.S.
|occupation    = Producer, screenwriter
|alma_mater    = Loyola Marymount UniversityUniversity of Southern California
}}
Paul Donaldson King (July 14, 1926 â€“ July 10, 1996) was an American producer and screenwriter. He was nominated for an Academy Award in the category Best Original Screenplay for the film Operation Petticoat.
King died in July 1996 of cancer at his home in Newport Beach, California, at the age of 69. He was interred at Pacific View Memorial Park in Corona del Mar, Newport Beach.
Selected filmography
* Operation Petticoat (1959; co-nominated with Stanley Shapiro, Maurice Richlin and Joseph Stone)
